answers.answer: With my DD I had what is called Gestation Diabetes, it's Diabetes that pregnant woman get.  My was monitered by diet.  With this pregnancy, 13 years later, I am scheduled to go see a Nutritionist to reduce the risk of getting it again.  But it is normal and they may have you take the 3 hour sugar test.
Thanks for your response, did this have any affect on your baby?

My best friend had it when she was pregnant with her son. She had to moniter her diet (which she didn't do well, her mom had to step in for her and do that) She had to test herself a couple times a day. Then, in October, she had one of the CUTEST little men you could imagine. It didn't have any affects on him. Good luck!!

there are many complications with gestational diabetes depending on how severe you have it.  They will perform a glucose tolerance test on you to see your severity.  you will drink this DELICIOUS (note the sarcasm) orange drink and they will draw your blood 1 hour later to measure how your body is tolerating it.My best friend had gestational diabetes with her son.  She was insulin dependant for the rest of her pregnancy.  Her son was born and was a 9 lb baby.  You are at risk of having a larger than normal baby.  Also, he was unable to regulate his sugar levels on his own so he spent the first 24 hours of his life in special care to monitor his sugar. (he was fine)  Everything was normal after that and her Gestational Diabetes was gone.Good luck!!

It didn't have any affect on my DD, but don't get me wrong depending on how bad you have it, it can cause problems, usually your baby will be larger in weight, but it's also very easy to control, expecially now a days.  Good Luck!

I have gd w/ this pregnancy. I am controlling it by diet and am pretty restricted to what I can eat.  My sil has it in her pregnancy this time too but her numbers are so crazy that she has to inject insulin but she does get to eat more things than I do because the insulin is controlling her blood sugar.  Either way they say a gd diet is good in pregnancy even if you dont have it because it constitutes a lot of veggies and proteins and not too many carbs and of course no junk food....although I have found lil things that I can have w/out having a bad number.  The dangers involved if not controlled can be disproportionate weight gain for the baby and possible still birth.  Its important so good you are getting it taken care of.  good luck and I hope you dont have it.
